statement._text: NoLoc - We need the necessities set up as swiftly as possible.  Food, Stone, Lumber, and Funds.
NoLoc - To get construction done, we’ll need Stones and Lumber for building material, and we need Funds to purchase the more delicate things we can’t just scrounge up.
NoLoc - We have to keep Food coming too. If we start running critically low, we’ll need to have all hands on deck foraging and hunting just to avoid starvation. Construction will halt completely.
NoLoc - Also, do bear in mind that our resource stockpile has a limit. We can only hold so much of everything before we can’t store any more.
NoLoc - Once we’ve got at least two resource production facilities and 1 home set up, we can start planning for the extended future.
NoLoc - Once we’ve got at least two resource production facilities and 1 home set up, we can start planning for the extended future.
NoLoc - So, what are we working on today?
No Loc -I want to build something.
no loc - skip week
No loc - You’re a pretty good engineer! Where did you learn all this?
no loc - bye
NoLoc - Improvement Tuto
NoLoc - Improvement Tuto
NoLoc - Improvement Tuto
NoLoc - Improvement Tuto
NoLoc - yay you sure?
no  loc - yea
no loc - no

NoLoc - Back when I was a bandit, I was the one who kept our essentials working. I made a primitive water filter and everything when I was a youth. After Dorion adopted me, he and Evangeline made sure I got the training I needed to refine my talents.
no loc - Wait...You used to be a bandit? You don’t seem like the type!
NoLoc - Outside of those fools who mistakenly think robbery is “easy money”, most “Bandits” reject that label. Anything larger than a small pack of people would likely call themselves “Independents”.
NoLoc - I was born into a clan. Ours never really grew over 30 in size. Foraging for food on your own tends to become difficult after that.
no loc - How did you end up engineer in a major city, then?

NoLoc - Our clan ran into disaster about 5 years ago. Disease. Our clan leader succumbed, and her replacement...She was cruel. Anyone displaying symptoms was cut down immediately. The group collapsed soon after.

NoLoc - And then, on a foraging trip, one of us accidentally woke a Gargoyle. As we tried to flee, I fell down a small ridge and broke my leg. My fellows left me behind, knowing that I would only slow them down.
NoLoc - If a forager from Sirocco hadn’t found me, a Torcrab likely would have put my out of my misery, and a Medyse would have used my corpse to incubate its eggs.

NoLoc -I am beyond thankful I was taken in and had my wounds treated. I was happy to lend my aid to these people, despite their initial mistrust. Dorion offering to make me his adopted son was an honor I still don’t feel worthy of.
no loc - So, how does civilization compare to the bandit life?

NoLoc - It’s nice not having to fear for my life every waking moment. It’s nice knowing that we all count on one another, and keep everyone alive. Even being a refugee trying to start over like this...It’s an improvement to life outside the walls.
NoLoc - Of course, I could do without the caste system the Nobility saddled us with. And I do miss many of my former companions. But overall, this life is much more stable.

NoLoc - I don’t blame many for choosing the life of an outlaw. Being true only to yourself and your crew, unbound by Blood Prices and restriction...It’s appealing to many. But the dangers are great. Not just to us, but those who we often have to prey upon just to survive.
NoLoc - Alright, let’s get the next set of tasks queued up then.

NoLoc -We’re working on nailing down our construction process, making it as streamlined and efficient as possible. Once we’ve got it up and running, we should be able to process more advanced materials, and create improvements to our buildings.

NoLoc - Evangeline and Dorion are both planning to set up some traditional Magma Forges to better forge certain construction materials, but...I’m sure there’s a better way. I know a Levant engineer made an furnace that outperforms our typical design...

NoLoc - We’ve set a timetable of about 80 days before we settle on a solution.  Once my work orders are cleared up, I should have the free time to come up with something more efficient. If you could help me clean my plate, here, I’d appreciate it.
NoLoc - We’ll need at least a total of 3 homes, and 2 specialized buildings completed before I can get on that task. I’m counting on you, [PlayerName]!

NoLoc - Whew! Now that I’ve got a little bit less work on my plate, I’ve been able to come up with a more effective furnace design. It would vastly improve the smelting of new bricks and other materials. Our workers would be able to do more with less resources.
NoLoc - The problem is, I’ll need a Volcanic Forge Stone to make it work. And any that we had were lost in the city’s collapse. I need you to make us a new one. Easier said than done, unfortunately.

NoLoc - Some of our Miners have dug out a big chunk of Quartz Crystal that will serve as the raw material for the Forge Stone. Bring it into the belly of the Eldest Brother, the Volcano behind Old Sirocco.
NoLoc - We have a site set up deep in the crater, where you can convert the Quartz into a Forge Stone. Once you’ve gotten it charged up, bring it home.  Easy as pie!
No loc - Won’t I...You know, catch fire, going into an active volcano?
No loc - I’ve actually been in there already. I’m shocked I didn’t drop dead of heat stroke!

NoLoc - Heh, do you think we’d live in a city with a volcano in our literal backyard and not have found a solution for the heat? We lined the lower levels with enchanted Volcanic Quartz. They absorb heat from the nearby environment, and make it safe to traverse.

NoLoc -In fact, when you visit the Eldest Brother, take a look up and you’ll see an enormous Enchanted Quartz. We call it the Emberheart. With a little coaxing from our mages, it can keep our living areas cool, while also redirecting that heat to charge up Forge Stones for us.
NoLoc -You ever wonder why being near open magma outside doesn’t give you heat stroke on the spot, [PlayerName]? You can thank the Emberheart for that. That’s the kind of power it has.
NoLoc -It’ll still be hot in there like nothing you’ve ever experienced, but you won’t catch fire just by being in there.
no loc  - And how do you expect me to carry such a huge chunk of Quartz? Do we have a wagon or something?
NoLoc - I’ve got one of our old harnesses meant for carrying Quartz on your back. Of course, this does mean you can’t carry it and a backpack at the same time, [PlayerName].
NoLoc - You should leave your backpack here in the settlement, [PlayerName], we’ll look after it in the meantime. Prepare yourself as best you can with what space you have in your pockets.
NoLoc - Oh, and if you happen to lose the large Quartz, let me know immediately. It will cost you if you want a replacement, but we can handle it for you.
no loc - How do I even get into the volcano in the first place?

NoLoc - There’s a large brass door in the back of Old Sirocco’s upper district. The route there was closed during the city’s collapse, but you should be able to reopen it. There’s a lever a little further down.
NoLoc - secret mode workaround - No need for crystal

NoLoc - Ah. There you are. Unfortunately, the Forge Stones came a little too late for me to finish up my improved furnace design.  We wound up installing the more traditional Magma Furnace design instead.
NoLoc -WWell, thanks anyway.  We’ll find a use for the Forge Stone you brought in regardless, and reward you for your work.  Still, shame about the loss of efficiency...

NoLoc - In any case, we can process advanced building materials with those furnaces. I’ve come up with a number of improvements we can make to our specialized buildings. Let me know what we need, and we’ll get it built!
NoLoc - Hah! You did it! Well, my improved furnace design is ready and waiting for this! Our efficiency with building materials just got a noticeable boost.  Thanks as always, [PlayerName]!
NoLoc - So, how’s the Forge stone coming along?
No loc - I have some construction I need done first.
No loc - I...Lost the large Crystal Quartz you gave me...
NoLoc - *sigh* I’m quite disappointed in you. Fine. A replacement is 100 silver. Maybe that’ll teach you to waste valuable Quartz!
No Loc - I''ll buy a new one.
no loc - No thanks
NoLoc - Alright, give me a moment...I’m going to go see if one of our miners has a chunk we can borrow...
NoLoc - Phew, there you are! Now don’t lose this one, you hear?

NoLoc - Ah. There you are. Unfortunately, the Forge Stones came a little too late for me to finish up my improved furnace design.  We wound up installing the more traditional Magma Furnace design instead.
NoLoc -WWell, thanks anyway.  We’ll find a use for the Forge Stone you brought in regardless, and reward you for your work.  Still, shame about the loss of efficiency...

NoLoc - In any case, we can process advanced building materials with those furnaces. I’ve come up with a number of improvements we can make to our specialized buildings. Let me know what we need, and we’ll get it built!
NoLoc - Hah! You did it! Well, my improved furnace design is ready and waiting for this! Our efficiency with building materials just got a noticeable boost.  Thanks as always, [PlayerName]!
NoLoc - Pick pack stuff!
Gimme uncharged!
Upgrade Pack!
NoLoc - Get BackPack!
No have backpack needed!!
No loc - Right, looks like I’m headed back through Old Sirocco’s back door, then.
